medium: Porcelain with polychrome glazes in the "egg-and-spinach" pattern
text: The basic green, yellow and aubergine of the <I>famille verte<I> palette of enamels developed during the Kang-hsi reign for precise pictorial decoration could also be washed over vessels to create variegate patterns. The particular pattern, seen here, likely a revival of T'ang dynasty "three-color" or <I>santsai<I> glazes, was given the fanciful name of "egg-and-spinach." Following the Kang-hsi reign, the <I>famille verte<I> palette lost much of its popularity.
title: Splash Dish
